subject: Cybersecurity
title: The Future of Cyber Norms: Building Rules for Digital Conflict
description: A fast breakdown of The Future of Cyber Norms: Building Rules for Digital Conflict for builders.

hook.text: Nuclear weapons have treaties. Chemical weapons have bans. Cyber weapons have... nothing binding.

buildup.text: The UN Group of Governmental Experts has proposed voluntary cyber norms: don't attack hospitals, don't hack.

discovery.text: Unlike physical weapons, cyberweapons are invisible, deniable, and easily attributed to others. This makes.

twist.text: Russia signed the UN cyber norms agreeing not to attack critical infrastructure. Then allegedly attacked.

climax.text: Cyber norms exist on paper. Enforcement remains the unsolved problem of international cybersecurity governance.

punchline.text: They signed the agreement. Then attacked the power grid.
